title: NYGC Lab Notebook
text: I maintain this open-source lab notebook in an effort to make my research reproducible. This is an erratic collection of ideas, figures and notes, mostly meant for personal use. If you are looking for my main portfolio, it’s here.

title: NYGC Lab Notebook
text:
Gene based RV association test. Deep learning burden test
Rare variant association tests: - burden tests collase rare variants into gene scores. e.g. ARIEL, CAST, WSS Loses power when variant effects are in opposing directions, or many non-causal variants. - adaptive burden tests, use weights and thresholds. e.g. ADA, aSum, VT - dispersion tests, test variance of genetic effect, e.g. SKAT, C-alpha, SSU - combined tests, burden + dispersion tests combined, e.g. SKAT-O, Fisher, MIST - annotation-based tests, add annotations to existing methods, e.g. STAAR, RAVA-FIRST, FST
FST. Coding variants - within start/end of genes defined by ensemble
NC variants - Activity-by-contact (ABC) model predicts promoter and enhancer regions of genes.
Rare variants only – gnomAD AF < 0.05
Map to annotations
Map to ADSP individuals
Functional Score Test
Why is the Mahattan plot skewed? Do you have a p-value from null model?
ESM annotaton.
